PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_MaterialWater
PropertySetDef.Definition: A set of extended material properties for of water typically used within the context of building services and flow distribution systems.

PropertyDef.Name: IsPotable
PropertyDef.Definition: If TRUE, then the water is considered potable.

PropertyDef.Name: Hardness
PropertyDef.Definition: Water hardness as positive, multivalent ion concentration in the water (usually concentrations of calcium and magnesium ions in terms of calcium carbonate).

PropertyDef.Name: AlkalinityConcentration
PropertyDef.Definition: Maximum alkalinity concentration (maximum sum of concentrations of each of the negative ions substances measured as CaCO3).

PropertyDef.Name: AcidityConcentration
PropertyDef.Definition: Maximum CaCO3 equivalent that would neutralize the acid.

PropertyDef.Name: ImpuritiesContent
PropertyDef.Definition: Fraction of impurities such as dust to the total amount of water. This is measured in weight of impurities per weight of water and is therefore unitless.

PropertyDef.Name: DissolvedSolidsContent
PropertyDef.Definition: Fraction of the dissolved solids to the total amount of water. This is measured in weight of dissolved solids per weight of water and is therefore unitless.

PropertyDef.Name: PHLevel
PropertyDef.Definition: Maximum water PH in a range from 0-14.
